text: Trino () is a comune in the Province of Vercelli in the Piedmont region in Italy. It is about northeast of Turin and about southwest of Vercelli, at the foot of the Montferrat hills. Trino is next to these municipalities: Bianz√®, Camino, Costanzana, Fontanetto Po, Livorno Ferraris, Morano sul Po, Palazzolo Vercellese, Ronsecco, and Tricerro. Trino was the site of Enrico Fermi Nuclear Power Plant. The Romanesque church of San Michele in Insula which were built in the 10th-11th centuries. It has 12th-century frescoes. The Lucedio Abbey is in the comune. == Twin towns == Trino is twinned with: * Chauvigny, France, since 1961 * Geisenheim, Germany, since 1974 * Banfora, Burkina Faso, since 1999 == References == == Other websites == * Official website Category:Settlements in Vercelli
title: Trino
